TopicTitle: The "Is this/when will this be ready for v1.0" Spam

Articles.Content:
It has been minutes since v1.0 has dropped and people on these forums are already spamming their favorite mod threads asking/demanding/whatever about v1.0. Come on people. Some haven't even got the wherewithal to read 2-3 posts prior to see if/when it will be done. Give the devs some time to update. This isn't an instantaneous thing.

I propose anybody who spams like this in the forum be banned for 2-3 weeks.

It's a nice idea. I just wish more modders put what version their mod is for in the title something like "[1.0] You're mod here (Version x.x.xxx)" This would allow people to know what version the mod is for as well as if a new version has been released.
True...In my experience MOST mods that I subscribe to do. Or at least a 'last updated' date.

This happens any time you have members of the community who haven't had time to learn how we do things here. You can respond effectively by politely redirecting these posters to more practical approaches:

- Ask them to test the mod thoroughly
- Describe their findings in the thread
- Post about it in the [mod compatibility list](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116916-Comprehensive-Mod-Compatibility-List-for-KSP-1-0) with a **link**, **version**, and what **works/doesn't work**.

(Closed.)
